result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by DE asking to appear by zoom for hearing scheduled today 10/13/22 at 11:00 AM.  Per TCH on 10/13/22- DE approved to appear by zoom.  Clerk called DE to let him know and gave him zoom info. bph

DE called stating he can't make it to court this morning and asking if he can appear by zoom.  Clerk advised it wasn't pre-approved, DE would need to file something in writing requesting to appear by zoom or phone.  DE given fax number and info needed. bph
Filed by DA Office pam B. arc

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nathan  F. or his property located at 311 Main Street North, Deer Park, WI. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:25 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt and Intern Lanie Krause in court for DE. Defendant Matthew Christopher McCarty in court, in custody by video. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. Bond arguments. Court sets PH, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:30 PM. kma
